*Count/Prince/Duke of [[Anhalt]] *[[Duke of Saxony]] *[[List of rulers of Brandenburg|Margrave of]] [[Margraviate of Brandenburg|Brandenburg]] *[[Duke of Saxe-Lauenburg]] *[[Saxe-Wittenberg|Duke of Saxe-Wittenberg]] *[[Electors of Saxony|Elector of]] [[Electorate of Saxony|Saxony]] *[[List of the rulers of Lüneburg|Prince of]] [[Principality of Lüneburg|Lüneburg]] *[[Empress and Autocrat of All the Russias]] *[[Empress consort of All the Russias]] [[Esiko, Count of Ballenstedt]] [[Joachim Ernst, Duke of Anhalt]] [[Eduard, Prince of Anhalt]] 1036 1918 [[Germans|German]] TheHouse of Ascania(lang-deAskanier) is adynastyof German rulers. It is also known as theHouse of Anhalt, afterPrincipality of AnhaltAnhalt, its longest-held possession.

The Ascanians are named after Ascania (or Ascaria) Castle,Schloss Askanien, which is located near and named afterAschersleben. The castle was seat of the County of Ascania, a title that was later subsumed into the titles of the princes of Anhalt.
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: The earliest known member of the house,Esiko, Count of Ballenstedt, first appears in a document of 1036, and is assumed to have been a grandson (through his mother) ofOdo I, Margrave of the Saxon Ostmark. From Odo, the Ascanians inherited large properties in theSaxon Eastern March.

Esiko's grandson wasOtto, Count of Ballenstedt, who died in 1123. By Otto's marriage toEilika of SaxonyEilika, daughter ofMagnus, Duke of Saxony, the Ascanians became heirs to half of the property of the House ofBillung, former dukes ofDuchy of SaxonySaxony.
Otto's son,Albert the Bear, became, with the help of his mother's inheritance, the first Ascanian duke of Saxony in 1139. But he lost control of Saxony soon to the rivalHouse of Guelph.

However, Albert inherited theMargraviate of Brandenburgfrom its lastWendsWendishruler,Pribislav of BrandenburgPribislav, in 1157, and became the first Ascanian margrave. Albert, and his descendants of the House of Ascania, then made considerable progress inChristianityChristianizingandGermanisationGermanizingthe lands. As a borderland between German andSlavsSlaviccultures, the country was known as amarchesmarch.

In 1237 and 1244 two towns,Cllnand Berlin were founded during the rule of Otto and Johann, grandsons of Margrave Albert the Bear, (later they were united into one city,Berlin). The emblem of the House of Ascania, red eagle and bear, became the heraldic emblems of Berlin.
In 1320 the Brandenburg Ascanian line came to an end.

After the Emperor had deposed the Guelph rulers of Saxony in 1180, Ascanians returned to rule the Duchy of Saxony, which had been reduced to its eastern half by the Emperor. However, even in eastern Saxony, the Ascanians could establish control only in limited areas, mostly near the River Elbe.

In the 13th century, thePrincipality of Anhaltwas split off from the Duchy, and later, the remaining state was split intoSaxe-LauenburgandSaxe-Wittenberg. The Ascanian dynasties in the two Saxon states became extinct in 1689 and in 1422, respectively, but Ascanians continued to rule in the smaller state of Anhalt and its various subdivisions until monarchy was abolished in 1918.
Catherine II of RussiaCatherine the Great, Empress of Russia from 17621796, was a member of the House of Ascania, herself the daughter ofChristian August, Prince of Anhalt-Zerbst.
